nodes.text: An IoT based home automation system can provide low cost wireless control of home appliances, enable automated operation from ambient conditions, reduce human interaction, improve energy efficiency and accessibility, and be scalable and secure
Design and development of firmware for smart control can automate appliance operation and minimize human interaction while preserving device integrity
A smart home that integrates environment-aware automation can improve energy performance, user comfort, and convenience
Home automation systems can increase accessibility for elderly and people with disabilities by replacing manual controls with automated processes
The proposed prototype uses an Android application as client and a microcontroller-based server to control appliances over WiFi
The application implements two control modes: switch mode (radio button toggles) and voice mode (microphone sends voice intent to Google servers, parsed as string commands)
The prototype provides remote switching via WiFi with an indoor range of approximately 150 feet and is controllable from any WiFi capable device
The prototype displays the status of each device in the smartphone application, is simple, economical, expandable, and designed to be highly scalable to add more functions and devices
The system implements secure control using SSL over TCP and SSH for appliance control
Implementation of firmware and automation logic involves software programming, circuit board design, WiFi and TCP/IP protocols, and web server logic
Android phone acts as client sending data via socket programming to the server controlling the microcontroller
Hardware and software components specified include Arduino UNO R3, Bluetooth module HC 05, relay module, printed circuit board, wires, power supply, WiFi, and Arduino IDE
Automated control and remote monitoring via IoT can reduce forgotten device usage that leads to electricity waste and associated environmental impacts
Voice control uses smartphone microphone to create an intent sent to Google servers; returned string data is parsed and processed to control appliances
Secure communication over SSL/TCP and SSH is used to protect remote control commands between client and server

Related work demonstrates common IoT approaches for smart homes such as using NodeMCU or Raspberry Pi, MQTT brokers, Google Assistant integration, and automatic reconnection for continuous WiFi availability
